comment: Professor was very kind and took her in the summer so the classes were very long and could get boring at times. Used ALEKS for all homework but it wasn't bad if you did a few problems every day. Tests were similar to ALEKS homework so pay attention and try to learn the material

Prof Leardine is pretty average, I don't really like math so I could just be biased. I honestly never attended the classes and I passed just fine, I was accused of cheating at one point but she let me redeem myself and was understanding. A due date didn't align with the one shown on the grades and when I pointed this out, she opened it back up
She is just great, and very helpful always looking to help her students!

TAKE HER FOR MATH 1111. She was so nice and helpful. It's a math class so you obviously have to learn stuff but she makes it very easy. Homework is all online and is easy to get high A's. Tests are not hard as long as you can do the study guides. I am not a math person and I got an A in her class. I would definitely take her class again.
I'm horrible at math and she taught at a very fast pace. However, she was very caring and wanted to help. I just couldn't catch up. If you're good at math, I do recommend her.

I had Instructor Leardine for MATH 1111 in fall 2021, and she was absolutely amazing! I cannot say enough wonderful things about her. She is one of those teachers who actually cares about making sure you understand materials. She had many tutoring and extra practice/credit opportunities.

She is a very good Math Professor. I came in thinking I was going to fail, but she teaches really well. There are many resources and alot of extra credit if you pay attention. :) She also grades tests with partial credit. She does teach at a pace, but after you learn a new concept there is practice for it.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment:
Prof. Leardine is very sweet, but I would agree with others her lectures can be extremely fast and office hours participation was less than ideal in my case. I'm not saying she's awful, just I didn't have a great experience. 

Make sure to raise your hand and actually ask questions if you have them.

Professor Leardine is great. She goes out of her way to help students who are unable to attend her office hours and she is super accessible outside of class. There's 4 tests, a final, and daily homework, but it's all fairly easy if you show up to class and ask for help.

she gave really clear, concise explanations and was always willing to go back and provide more examples. so many opportunities to meet with her out of class. if u do the work and listen in class its very easy
Amazing Professor we had 3 tests and the final exam. She wants to make sure every one of her students understands the martial. DO THE STUDY GUIDE EXACTLY LIKE THE TEST!!!!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: I loved Prof. Leardine. The lectures were super easy to follow and there's homework due every week. The study guides are a must and there were tons of opportunities for extra credit. I would definitely recommend this class. It was fun and interesting.

She's a fantastic professor that cares about her students. If you need help, she's always available during her office hours. She's using ALEKS for her class, and all the hw is there. The class consists of 3 tests and one final and weekly hw. If you want to do well on the tests, go to class and take the study guide in ALEKS.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She is a great professor. All you need to do to pass is pay attention in class, go to her office hours, do the hw, and complete the study guides. If I tried harder, I would have gotten a higher grade but I definitely recommend taking

Very good teacher, she always wants to make sure you understand things. She's always available for help outside of class and answers any questions you have. There is homework every week but it isn't hard, you don't really have to study if you do the hw and there's only 4 tests.

Professor leardine was an amazing professor and as long as you showed up for class and referenced the notes most of the homework was a breeze. If you take her course you need to focus on math work and study for her tests. That guarantees a good grade in her class. I would definitely take her again
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: She doesnt respect her students time or effort, if you attend her office hours she will rush you and make you feel like a burden. She also doesnt give any extra credit and all test require a lockdown browser with cameras on. I wish I could give zero stars because thats what she deserves.

Prof. Leardine is really nice, but her test grading is weird. I got 5 points off of an exam and I got a C. She's super available for extra help because she has office hours once a week. I'm rarely able to attend class because of personal reasons but all the notes are available online!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: I really liked her. She is sweet and is very insistent on us asking questions to make sure we know the material. You will have to put in the work just like any math class, but as long as you come to class you'll be fine.

Prof was one of my favorites so far, I had her for summer 2021. You do all your work on Aleks and as long as you pay attention you will do good. Her lectures were really engaging and she would stop in the middle of notes to either play Kahoot, Quizezz, or other activities like that. My class was almost 3 hrs long but went by super quickly.

I honestly dont know why her rating is so high. She is the absolute worst math professor that Ive ever encountered. If you visit her during office hours she will rush you just so she can tend to other students.  Therefore if you struggle in math in any way DO NOT TAKE HER!!!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Leardine is actually a great professor. If you go to class and pay attention both online or in-person, the work is easy. Most of her class is weekly homework on ALEKS. No quizzes but 4 Test and the Final replaces lowest test score. Participation is bonus at the end so just do it, it helps you study too. She is really sweet and caring!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: I personally did not enjoy her class. She often rushed through the content which made me not understand the material. Most of the time, I used YouTube to help me. I would suggest watching YouTube videos and attending her office hours. Even when you go to her office hours weekly she wont even consider the effort that you put in and help you pass.

Absolute sweet heart. I had something really bad happen to me during the semester and had to take over a week off from class. She was more than accommodating including pushing my hw back a little further. Attend class and if you dont understand go to office hours I went from a 56 in her class to 86. She is more than willing to help if you ask.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Very good at explaining things. She is very sweet and is very patient. Lectures can be fast, because she assumes if no hands are raised then everyone understands, so if you have a question make sure to ask it.

Dr. Leardine is a phenomenal teacher. She is very bubbly and stays after class to answer all questions and is very thorough in her lectures. She sings when moving slides and uses goformative and desmos quite often. Her assignments are through ALEKS which is pretty useful when learning. Highly encourages you to attend office hours if you need help.
Terrible teacher. She is brand new coming from a high school and doesn't even cover some material for the homework. A lot of it is figuring out on your own. I would stay clear.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Chester Leardine is amazing !! She really cares for her students ! I took this as a hybrid class where we rotated in person and online . She really cares if you understand !! Her class was easy in my opinion ! Great teacher .
